definition: to jam/to choke/to clutch/also pr. [qia3 zhu4]
to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: His fingers were about her throat and no sound emerged.
sentences.chinese: 他的手指就卡住了她的喉咙，她发不出声音。

sentences.english: The faucets on my kitchen sink are stuck. I can't turn them off.
sentences.chinese: 我厨房水槽上面的水龙头给卡住了，我关不上。

sentences.english: but the gun just clicks.  Jammed.
sentences.chinese: 但是枪只发出了卡答声，被卡住了。

sentences.english: The first marine was stuck, maybe three-quarters of the way up the stairway.
sentences.chinese: 第一个美军被卡住了，也许是在楼梯往上四分之三处。

sentences.english: One, at dinner, a fish bone stuck my throat, but I did not feel uncomfortable.
sentences.chinese: 某天，吃晚饭，喉咙卡住了鱼骨头。

sentences.english: The knife was stuck but she pulled it out with a jerk.
sentences.chinese: 刀子被卡住了，她猛地一拔，把它拔了出来。

sentences.english: A murderer killed the child by choking the life out of him.
sentences.chinese: 一个杀人犯卡住这孩子的脖子把他扼死了。

sentences.english: "Thirty-eight hundred?" I repeated, with a catch in my throat.
sentences.chinese: “三千八？”我重复道，好像有异物卡住了嗓子一样。

sentences.english: You ever gotten stuck in a pair of leather pants?
sentences.chinese: 好吧，你曾经被自己的皮裤卡住了？

sentences.english: B︰There is another fault. The front passenger window jams half-way up.
sentences.chinese: 还有一个毛病，前座乘客的窗口关到一半就卡住了。

sentences.english: The accountant checked this unnecessary spending in good time.
sentences.chinese: 会计及时卡住了这笔不必要的开支。

sentences.english: The window had stuck, but he pushed it hard and it swung free.
sentences.chinese: 窗户卡住了，但是他用力猛推就打开了。

sentences.english: I couldn't unstick the Pepsi caps from her garbage disposer.
sentences.chinese: 我无法从她的垃圾处理器中取出卡住的百事可乐罐子。

sentences.english: The bolt and handle are deadlocked against turning.
sentences.chinese: 门闩和把手全卡住了，转动不了。

sentences.english: No. he said he'd jammed the slide and had to put it in for repair.
sentences.chinese: 他说他把滑座卡住了，只好拿去修理。

definition: to detain/to hold back by force/to buckle/to hook
to be unable to move a single step
to hook onto/to hitch onto/to catch onto
to press down/to crush down/to restrain (anger)/to keep down (voice)
to draw (towards)/to be drawn to/to be sucked in
to insert/to stick in/to plug in (an electronic device)
